newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: SOCCER-JARDEL LIKELY TO START AGAINST AC MILAN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JARDEL LIKELY TO START AGAINST AC MILAN.

text.p: Brazilian striker Mario Jardel is likely to start Porto's European Champions' League group D match against AC Milan on Wednesday after his two goals in the upset 3-2 win in Milan.
"They are strong but we are the favourites," said Jordel, who came on for the second half of the first match.
Porto, unbeaten so far in the qualifying group, need only draw against the five times European champions to ensure top place.
"Our aim is to guarantee first place in the group, but we recognise that the task will not be easy," Porto trainer Antonio Oliveira said.
AC Milan, strengthened by the return of captain Franco Baresi, forced a 0-0 draw against reigning European champions Juventus in a Serie A clash in Turin on Sunday.

Baresi, whose steadying influence helped his side keep their first clean sheet of the season in the Italian league, is expected to line up against Porto, with in-form Roberto Baggio also likely to start in attack alongside Liberian George Weah.
But the Italians will be without influential midfielder Demetrio Albertini, who like Porto defender Paulinho Santos, is ruled out after picking up two yellow cards in the competition.
Porto, who are bidding for their third successive domestic league title, are at the centre of a series of allegations of attempted match fixing.
But there was no sign that the off-field controversies were affecting their play when they beat Rio Ave 1-0 away at the weekend to strengthen their grip on the league.
The club expects 50,000 spectators, the maximum allowed by UEFA at Porto's Antas ground for European matches, to give them rousing support against the Italians.

Porto (probable) - 24-Henrique Hilario; 2-Joao Pinto, 4-Aloisio Alves, 22-Jorge Costa, 5-Fernando Mendes, 7-Sergio Conceicao, 11-Ljubimko Drulovic, 21-Edmilson Pimenta, 25-Zlatko Zahovic, 14-Artur Oliveira, 16-Mario Jardel.
